intro: Avenastrum caffrum, commonly known as the Cape horse-tail, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit and its ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often forming a compact rosette. Avenastrum caffrum is also known for its historical use in traditional medicine and as a source of fiber.
